pages.title: ⎧ Page of Wands ⎧
pages.text: Rose of the Palace of Fire$(br)      $(m)∇$() Earth of ∆ Fire

A young person stands in a barren and mountainous landscape. They hold a walking staff that has leaves sprouting from its tip.$(br)  They seem to be examining their staff, joyful for the fertile growth of the sprouts, even in this unlikely place.$(br)  The arid mountains are behind, a sign of elemental Fire, that skyward force that raises life from inert matter.$(br)  The heat of Fire is the spirit world imprinting itself on our actions.

This card carries qualities of movement, eagerness, and the inner growth that sprouts through our adventures. $(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Strength, eagerness, especially for new projects, great activity.$(br)  Passion that is innocent at the same time.$(br)  It can represent a person who is forthright and positive, who keeps no secrets, who brings a message.
$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Can mean laziness or exhaustion; also indecision and the instability which goes with it.$(br)  It can represent someone who holds back feelings.
